snippet: Mark Fields says he will not be distracted by reports that he is a favorite to succeed Alan Mulally as chief executive when he retires.
abstract: Mark Fields, head of Ford Motor's North and South American operations, says in an interview that he will not be distracted by a flurry of reports that the company's board plans to name him chief operating officer and solidify his status as the top candidate to succeed chief executive Alan R Mulally.
lead_paragraph: Mark Fields says he will not be distracted by reports that he is a favorite to succeed Alan Mulally as chief executive when he retires.

headline.seo: Amid Succession Talk, Ford Focuses on New Fusion
headline.main: As Succession Talk Stirs, Ford Focuses on New Car
